thread.title: Phenom People Names First Chief People Officer

author: cnbc.com
title: Phenom People Names First Chief People Officer
text:
HORSHAM, Pa., Phenom People, the leader in Talent Relationship Marketing (TRM), announced it has named Brad Goldoor as its first Chief People Officer. In his new role, Goldoor is charged with employee engagement through HR strategy; implementing new practices for enriching company culture, leadership and talent management, and overseeing onboarding and off-boarding team members.
Brad Goldoor is appointed Phenom People's Chief People Officer
“As we continue to thrive and hold true to our core belief that people should love what they do, we have unwavering trust in Brad to maintain and constantly improve the work lives of our Phenom family,” said Mahe Bayireddi, CEO of Phenom People.
Goldoor co-founded Phenom People in 2010 and held multiple roles within the organization. Prior to founding Phenom People, Goldoor was the President at a marketing & advertising agency, Sales Director at CareerBuilder and Gannett, and Co-Founder with Phenom People’s CEO and COO at SnipSnap, an app that scans printed coupons to a mobile phone.
“Phenom People built its vision and mission on the importance of the candidate and employee experience,” said Goldoor. “I am dedicated to embody that value in everything we do to ensure the health of our company starts with the positive livelihood of our people.”
About Phenom People
Phenom People, the leader in Talent Relationship Marketing, helps companies attract phenomenal talent through personalized digital experiences. The Phenom People Talent Relationship Marketing platform automates the complex process of driving awareness, interest, engagement, and acquisition for qualified talent.
For more information, please visit www.phenompeople.com to learn more about Talent Relationship Marketing.
